name: Weyland - BWBI v2
description:
Basic idea is to be able to shrug off bad publicity as I can. I think it still needs some tweaking but I'm not sure where to go from here.

The version of this deck that I've been using, pre-Second Thoughts, has worked pretty well. It has enough power to scorched earth kill them or just go for an agenda victory if they've been able to keep the tags off.

name: Andromeda R&D + HQ
description:
Andy has been working out well for a while. There isn't to much that's special about this one other then it being built to get in, get out, and keep the corp broke along the way.

With an older version of this, -R&D interface -Hostages, every so often I'd run into money issues when I couldn't get connections drawn. Hopefully Hostages should help with that while adding in R&D's should let me go digging further down when you do get in.

name: The Professor
description:
This one just needs some tweaking and I'm honestly not sure where. If everything works as plan it's a great deck but if everything doesn't go as plan it's frustrating as hell to play.

I like the idea of the Professor, I just need to make it work more consistently now.

name: Celebrity Surprise!
description:
A Jinteki deck that I've been playing for a bit. It tends to do brilliantly against careless runners and terribly against careful ones.

There's next to no Ice in here - the aim is to keep the runner nervous. What there is is aimed at either an early game rush (Barrier/Chimera to score a quick Agenda while the runner is setting up) or mind games - always advance whatever the Matrix Analyser is protecting if you can.

Since there's no ice, the runner is essentially free to get as much money as they want. It won't buy them more cards!

This deck is built with all cards up to (and including) Opening Moves but only one Core. With a second Core and Second Thoughts, I plan to swap out the PADs (which are usually ineffectual) and Niseis (too hard to score for no real benefit) for a third Melange (which is a useful card for 6 creds in one turn, more often than not) and three Clone Retirements.

name: The Key To Your Cards
description:
Cards up to C&C, one core set. Built before Opening Moves came out, but not sure if I would actually replace anything in here from that.

The Test Runs I'm unsure about - they used to be SMC but I switched in order to get some recursion options. Having played it a bit, I'm considering switching back and finding space for a Clone Chip or two instead.

Finance can turn out a bit tight, but usually it works out OK.

name: Midseason Celebrity v7
description: Last iteration of the Midseason / psycho deck powered by Celeb Gift

name: Gabriel: Core Set "Improvements"
description:
My first attempt at adapting the starter deck from the core set into a more streamline build with influence.

Ideally Bank job would be more copies of Desperado.

name: H-B: Core Set "Improvements"
description: First attempt at tweaking the Corp. starter deck. Could do with a few more ways to get cash money.

name: Bioroided Out
description: Pure focus on Bioroid. Get it out for free. Force the runner through enough to remove Bioroid click weakness, and make him/her pay severe damage (or die) to ignore it.
